result.execSummary:
The defendant James I. Montroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Prison sentence now serving.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at a restitution hearing.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with Fred Berg.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of letter sent to victim by VW Coordinator notifying him of today's hearing and that he needs to appear.

Attorney Stephanie Osborne present for defense.  No appearance by defendant; notice of hearing was not returned undelivered.  Attorney Osborne states this hearing was scheduled when he was in Fox Lake.  Last contact was in September.  DA Fox states he would have still been at Fox Lake when the notice was mailed to him there.  Letter to victim from Victim Witness Coordinator made a part of the record.  He was notified he needed to appear at this hearing.  Court cannot proceed without victim being present to give testimony.  Attorney Osborne states the items listed from victim does not match the list in the police statement; conflicting statements and burden of proof is on the victim.  Court finds the victim was provided with adequate notice; $0.00 awarded for restitution and finds victim has waived any restitution for failure to appear at hearing.
of JOC.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendnat appeared by video from Fox Lake Correctional.  Attorney Osborne appeared in person.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Rights explained.  Attorney Osborne requests another STC to work on agreement.  STC 9/14/15 at 3 pm.

Hearing at 08-31-2015 10:45 am

Alyssa called from Fox Lake Correctional as the defendant is now housed there.  She will leave information for other personnel regarding scheduling a time for him to call the DA for his pre-trial and scheduling a phone status conference on 8-10-15 as they won't be able to do a VTC.  I gave her the DA's phone number to schedule a time for the PTC and gave her Jen's number regarding calling in for the status conference on 8-10-15.
NOH for 7-2 Initial appearance / "not deliverable as addressed"

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Dodge Correctional.  Court advised the defendant of the charge pending and possible penalties.  Defendant talked to SPD.  He doesn't qualify.  Court advised other options regarding counsel.  Defendant will represent himself.  Complaint amended on the record to reflect correct middle name.  Court reviewed right to waive counsel on the record, with the defendant.  He understood waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently and voluntarily waived his right to counsel.  Defendant plead not guilty.  NGP entered.  State to send pre-trial offer through the mail.
